title: Designing Symbolic Interaction Strategies for Workplace-Based E-Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Professional Field (Medical/Legal/Technical) Practical Experience and Collaborative Knowledge within Organizations
context.additional_context: Strengthening e-learning design competencies through organizational learning and symbolic interaction in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can analyze symbolic meanings at individual and organizational levels when designing workplace-based e-learning tools.
Learners can propose at least three interaction strategies linked to peer groups and institutional policies.
Learners can implement e-learning scenarios reflecting their identity and values in role-play format.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
